I dunno what the hell ANY of that other stuff is...BUT...I agree that you'r=
e underestimated and I also think your very best work is yet to come. 
=C2=
=A0
:) :) :) 
=C2=A0
KIts would be neat!
=C2=A0
-Jerome

--- On Thu, 12/2/1=
0, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


From: Frank Sumption=
 <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Yeah, it can be advanced. [=
5 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, RTSC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thur=
sday, December 2, 2010, 10:38 AM


=C2=A0 


[Attachment(s) from Frank Sump=
tion included below] 

=C2=A0Dual supply, linear sweep, treble-bass filter,=
=C2=A0audio amps. Tuner is a separate board, so this layout is not dependen=
t on what tuner is available. Me thinks=C2=A0I am vastly underestimated. Ce=
llphone camera--crappy! Dual supply=3Dit needs=C2=A0 + and - 12 volts to fu=
nction. Two 12 volts supplies--two 8-AA battery packs or two 12V gel cells,=
 or NiMh packs--or what ever. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0BTW, I have a random sweep boar=
d too, the boards are designed to stack=C2=A0 :-) and no, I can't mass prod=
uce these either. But... 3 boards for $85 from ExpressPCB, solder=C2=A0mask=
 and silk screened, just add components and shake. There's a few SMT resist=
ors and caps, but that's pretty easy.=C2=A0 PBCs are easy, the only hold up=
 is tuners. 1/8th watt resistors and standard caps can be used in the tone =
section. I know, about impossible to see. Tuners are the problem. Thios was=
 designed to be used wiht car tuners, but any tuner will work. There is a t=
hree input mixer section that combines the left and right stereo channels, =
and an AM channel from a seperate tuner if needed. But wait, there's more, =
it has the mic amp for the echo chamber as well. One would have to supply a=
ll components, controls and switches. This is not a simple project. 
=C2=A0=

=C2=A0Chris Moon's latest box is done with the PCBs and a RS Arm Band tune=
r, his daughter's uses a car tuner with=C2=A0the same PCBs. It's two years =
old. Not the first printed boards I have done. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0I usually do p=
erf board and point to point wiring to save money. I should be doing kits o=
r something. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0FYI, the tone control I found on the web, just s=
o you are aware when some one tries to bootleg the boards. Ripping off some=
one's designs may have consequences-that's why I don't sell these, paying r=
oyalties reduces my labor profit from 5 cents an hour to 2 cents an hour.
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0The point is, if you have tuners, excess money, and want a spi=
ffy looking box, you can have PCBs made. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Sooooo, at the risk =
of everyone wanting to order these----I can't take orders for PCBs, I don't=
 have the tuners, and I don't have the $$$$$$ extra for boards.=C2=A0 The b=
oxes I sold for very reduced prices at Rolling Hills is what financed these=
 boards. I don't make any money on boxes, I barely get enough to buy parts,=
 and labor? Forget about it. 
=C2=A0
F-S
